intro: Aporosa benthamiana, commonly known as the Benthams' aporosa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it of interest to botanists and horticulturists studying tropical flora.
